title: (x) What the font is it?! / contemporary sloped blackletter - Klute White {Hrant, Andreas H}
content:
Hello there, does anyone know the name of this type face (and no, it isnt called 'Travels with Harlequin' hehe), apologies for the poor quality image.

Thanks its driving me insane in the membrane.

EC

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [sharp type.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100211190134/http:/typophile.com/files/sharp%20type.jpg) | 41.96 KB |
author: craftytent

comments.content:
Hmm, looks a lot like Humanoid by Andreas Nylin.

Look at the "designboom" logo on this page: [http://www.designboom.com/eng/cool/andreas.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20100211190134/http:/www.designboom.com/eng/cool/andreas.html "http://www.designboom.com/eng/cool/andreas.html")

Edit: On second look, it's similar and maybe a good alternative font, but I swear I have that font in my collection. I just can't place the name. I'm fairly certain it's a free font. Have you tried looking through DaFont's collection?

This is the fascinating and seminal Klute.  
The London Olympics font is derived from it.  
 [http://typophile.com/node/34381](http://web.archive.org/web/20100211190134/http:/typophile.com/node/34381 "http://typophile.com/node/34381")

hhp

Klute White to be precise. In which the a unfortunately looks much like an o.  
Andreas

Klute White it is! Thank you for your help! Muchly appreciated. Now I can sleep easy.

EC
